subsections.title: Cody Overview
highlights: Western gateway to Yellowstone via East Entrance
Historic town founded by Buffalo Bill Cody
Known for rodeos, museums, and proximity to Wapiti Valley

subsections.title: Cooke City Overview
highlights: Small alpine town near Yellowstone’s Northeast Entrance
Known for rugged beauty, backcountry access, and snowmobiling
Remote but scenic with limited services

subsections.title: Top Attractions in Cody
highlights: Buffalo Bill Center of the West – five museums in one
Cody Nite Rodeo – nightly summer rodeo action
Old Trail Town – preserved frontier buildings
Cody Firearms Experience – shooting range and museum

subsections.title: Dining & Lodging – Cody
highlights: Irma Hotel – historic saloon and prime rib buffet
Proud Cut Saloon – steaks and Western fare
8th Street at the Ivy – upscale local favorite
Cody Hotel, Chamberlin Inn, budget motels and RV parks

subsections.title: Dining & Lodging – Cooke City
highlights: Miner's Saloon – pizza, beer, and town hangout
Beartooth Café – summer burgers and local fare
Cooke City Alpine Motel – rustic and walkable
Super 8, cabins, and a few seasonal lodges

subsections.title: Wapiti Valley Highlights
highlights: Shoshone River canyon scenery
Absaroka Mountain views
Campgrounds and outfitters dotting the route
Watch for bison, elk, and bald eagles

subsections.title: Outdoor Adventure
highlights: Fishing on the Shoshone River (Cody area)
Hiking: Elk Fork Trail, Hayden Arch Bridge
Snowmobiling and backcountry skiing (Cooke City)
Wildlife photography from Northeast Entrance corridor

subsections.title: Cultural Events & Local Experiences
highlights: Cody Stampede Rodeo (July 1–4)
Buffalo Bill Art Show & Sale (September)
Live music, cowboy poetry, parades throughout summer
Visitor center walking tours and local storytelling nights

subsections.title: Campgrounds & Access Routes
highlights: Cody KOA and Buffalo Bill State Park Campgrounds
Wapiti Campground (first-come, riverfront access)
Pebble Creek Campground near Cooke City
Lamar Valley access from Cooke City (best for wildlife)

subsections.title: Loop Integration & Travel Tips
highlights: Cody is best for museums, basecamp before Yellowstone
Cooke City is great for early wildlife spotting in Lamar
Drive Chief Joseph to connect Cody to Beartooth Hwy
Limited services in Cooke City—fuel up and stock snacks
